action.name: Multiattack
entries: The decapus makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tentacles.

action.name: Mossegada
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} a impactar, 5 peus d'abast, one creature {@condition grappled} by the decapus. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) de dany perforant.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} a impactar, 10 peus d'abast, un objectiu. {@h}24 ({@damage 9d4 + 2}) dany contundent or 14 ({@damage 5d4 + 2}) dany contundent if the decapus is grappling a creature other than the target or if the decapus is on the ground or floor. The target is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) unless the decapus is already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Boulder Guise
entries: While fully withdrawn into its shell, the geonid can't see and is indistinguishable from a small boulder

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} a impactar, 5 peus d'abast, un objectiu. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) dany contundent.

action.name: Stone Tell
entries: The geonid touches a stone object or surface and knows what types of creatures have been within 10 feet of that stone in the past 24 hours. The geonid can also determine the number of creatures of each type, but not their identities.

spellcasting.name: Llançament de conjurs Innat
headerEntries: The slug's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} a impactar with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The slug has advantage a tirades d'habilitat de Saviesa ({@skill Perception}) que involucrin olorar.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The slug can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slug makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} a impactar, 10 peus d'abast, una criatura. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) de dany de verí, i l'objectiu ha de superar una salvada de Constitution amb {@dc 13} o be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

action.name: Mossegada
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} a impactar, 5 peus d'abast, un objectiu. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) de dany perforant.

reaction.name: Animate Tentacle
entries: When the slug takes damage in this cave ({@adventure Shrine of Umberlee|ttp|3|24. Shrine of Umberlee}), it can use its reaction to animate one of the tentacles of the kraken statue and cause it to   make a melee weapon attack ({@hit 3} a impactar) against one creature within 20 feet of the statue that the slug can see. The tentacle deals 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) dany contundent on a hit.

monster.name: Topi
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The topi has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Resiliència No-morta
entries: If damage reduces the topi to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the topi drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Venomous Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} a impactar, 5 peus d'abast, un objectiu. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) de dany tallant plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) de dany de verí, i l'objectiu ha de superar una salvada de Constitution amb {@dc 11} o be {@condition poisoned} until the end of the target's next turn.

items.name: Two Heads
entries: The two-headed plesiosaurus has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

items.name: Multiattack
entries: The two-headed plesiosaurus makes two bite attacks.
